quotes.message: Acting childish seems to come naturally, but acting like an adult, no matter how old we are, just doesn't come easy to us.
quotes.name: Lily Tomlin

quotes.message: It is unbecoming for young men to utter maxims.
quotes.name: Aristotle

quotes.message: Cheerfulness and contentment are great beautifiers and are famous preservers of youthful looks.
quotes.name: Charles Dickens

quotes.message: Whatever you may look like, marry a man your own age -- as your beauty fades, so will his eyesight.
quotes.name: Phyllis Diller

quotes.message: Blessed are the young for they shall inherit the national debt.
quotes.name: Herbert Hoover

quotes.message: By the time a man realizes that maybe his father was right, he usually has a son who thinks he's wrong.
quotes.name: Charles Wadsworth

quotes.message: It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: Anyone who stops learning is old, whether at 20 or 80. Anyone who keeps learning stays young. The greatest thing in life is to keep your mind young.
quotes.name: Henry Ford

quotes.message: here are three great friends: an old wife, an old dog, and ready money.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: Life's Tragedy is that we get old to soon and wise too late.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: A diplomat is a man who always remembers a woman's birthday but never remembers her age.
quotes.name: Robert Lee Frost

quotes.message: Love grants in a moment what toil can hardly achieve in an age.
quotes.name: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.message: Nothing is more damaging to a new truth than an old error.
quotes.name: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.message: People far prefer happiness to wisdom, but that is like wanting to be immortal without getting older.
quotes.name: Sydney J Harris

quotes.message: Nobody can be so amusingly arrogant as a young man who has just discovered an old idea and thinks it is his own.
quotes.name: Sydney J Harris

quotes.message: In youth men are apt to write more wisely than they really know or feel; and the remainder of life may be not idly spent in realizing and convincing themselves of the wisdom which they uttered long ago.
quotes.name: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quotes.message: Remember, if you ever need a helping hand, you'll find one at the end of your arm. . . . As you grow older you will discover that you have two hands. One for helping yourself, the other for helping others.
quotes.name: Audrey Hepburn

quotes.message: he misery of a child is interesting to a mother, the misery of a young man is interesting to a young woman, the misery of an old man is interesting to nobody.
quotes.name: Eric Hoffer

quotes.message: To be 70 years young is sometimes far more cheerful and hopeful than to be 40 years old.
quotes.name: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr

quotes.message: The advice of their elders to young men is very apt to be as unread as a list of the hundred best books.
quotes.name: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr

quotes.message: Old age is fifteen years older than I am.
quotes.name: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr

quotes.message: There is no friend like an old friend who has shared our morning days, no greeting like his welcome, no homage like his praise.
quotes.name: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr

quotes.message: Forty is the old age of youth; fifty is the youth of old age.
quotes.name: Victor Hugo

quotes.message: So different are the colours of life, as we look forward to the future, or backward to the past; and so different the opinions and sentiments which this contrariety of appearance naturally produces, that the conversation of the old and young ends generally with contempt or pity on either side.
quotes.name: Victor Hugo

quotes.message: Same old slippers, Same old rice, Same old glimpse of paradise.
quotes.name: William James Lampton

quotes.message: The surprising thing about young fools is how many survive to become old fools.
quotes.name: Doug Larson

quotes.message: The day a person becomes a cynic is the day he loses his youth.
quotes.name: Marvin D. Levy

quotes.message: It is an illusion that youth is happy, an illusion of those who have lost it.
quotes.name: Audrey Hepburn

quotes.message: The American ideal is youth -- handsome, empty youth.
quotes.name: Henry Miller

quotes.message: The older you get the stronger the wind gets-and it's always in your face.
quotes.name: Jack Nicklaus

quotes.message: You don't stop laughing because you grow old; You grow old because you stop laughing.
quotes.name: Michael Pritchard

quotes.message: A man is not old as long as he is seeking something.
quotes.name: Jean Rostand

quotes.message: Thou shouldst not have been old till thou hadst been wise.
quotes.name: William Shakespeare

quotes.message: It's all that the young can do for the old, to shock them and keep them up to date.
quotes.name: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.message: The mere process of growing old together will make the slightest acquaintance seem a bosom friend.
quotes.name: Logan Pearsall Smith

quotes.message: Growing old is nothing more than mind over matter; If you don't mind, it doesn't matter.
quotes.name: Anonymous

quotes.message: Our dilemma is that we hate change and love it at the same time; what we really want is for things to remain the same but get better.
quotes.name: Sydney J Harris

quotes.message: The charm of history and its enigmatic lesson consist in the fact that, from age to age, nothing changes and yet everything is completely different.
quotes.name: Aldous Leonard Huxley

quotes.message: Happiness is not a goal; it is a by-product.
quotes.name: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.message: The difference between greatness and mediocrity is often how an individual views a mistake...
quotes.name: Nelson Boswell

quotes.message: Beware of the young doctor and the old barber.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: The difference between a successful person and others is not a lack of strength, not a lack of knowledge, but a lack of will.
quotes.name: Norman Vincent Peale

quotes.message: A thing is not necessarily true because badly uttered, nor false because spoken magnificently.
quotes.name: Saint Augustine

quotes.message: No form of Nature is inferior to Art; for the arts merely imitate natural forms.
quotes.name: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus

quotes.message: God has placed in each soul an apostle to lead us upon the illumined path. Yet many seek life from without, unaware that is within them.
quotes.name: Audrey Hepburn

quotes.message: I don't feel old. I don't feel anything until noon. Then it's time for my nap.
quotes.name: Bob Hope

quotes.message: We could certainly slow the aging process down if it had to work its way through Congress.
quotes.name: Unknown

quotes.message: Don't worry about avoiding temptation...As you grow older, it will avoid you.
quotes.name: Unknown

quotes.message: Maybe it's true that life begins at fifty. But ... everything else starts to wear out, fall out, or spread out.
quotes.name: Unknown

quotes.message: By the time a man is wise enough to watch his step, he's too old to go anywhere.
quotes.name: Unknown

quotes.message: It's hard to be nostalgic when you can't remember anything.
quotes.name: Unknown

quotes.message: At my age, every doctor says the same thing; It's either something I have to live with - or something I have to live without.
quotes.name: Unknown

quotes.message: The secret of staying young is to live honestly, eat slowly and lie about your age.
quotes.name: Lucile Ball

quotes.message: As we grow older everything seems to wear out, fall out or spread out.
quotes.name: Unknown

quotes.message: Birthdays are good for you. Studies show that the people who have the most live the longest.
quotes.name: Unknown
